judges: Before Bell, C. J., Jones, Cohen, O’Brien and Pomeroy, JJ.
Mr. Justice Cohen took no part in the decision of this case.
Mr. Justice Eagen and Mr. Justice Roberts took no part in the consideration or decision of this case.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
Judgment of sentence affirmed.
Mr. Justice Cohen took no part in the decision of this case.
Mr. Justice Eagen and Mr. Justice Roberts took no part in the consideration or decision of this case.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Melvin M. Dildine, Assistant District Attorney, with him Milton M. Stein, Assistant District Attorney, James D. Crawford, Deputy District Attorney, Rich-curd A. Sprague, First Assistant District Attorney, and Arlen Specter, District Attorney, for Commonwealth, appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Commonwealth v. Johnson, Appellant.
Argued November 20, 1970.
Before Bell, C. J., Jones, Cohen, O’Brien and Pomeroy, JJ.
Joseph Michael Smith, for appellant.
Melvin M. Dildine, Assistant District Attorney, with him Milton M. Stein, Assistant District Attorney, James D. Crawford, Deputy District Attorney, Rich-curd A. Sprague, First Assistant District Attorney, and Arlen Specter, District Attorney, for Commonwealth, appellee.
January 7, 1971:
